subject: Re: [PATCH 1/4] memcg: use mod_node_page_state to update stats

reviews.author: Sebastian Siewior
reviews.summary: Reviewer Sebastian Siewior pointed out a potential issue in __folio_migrate_mapping() where IRQ enable at the end does nothing and might cause CPU migration between stats updates, but stated it's fine if left as is.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: Shakeel Butt raised concerns that the patch may cause a regression on arm64 due to the use of LL/SC instructions in this_cpu_ops, and suggested adding batched stats update functionality to fix the issue.

reviews.author: Harry Yoo (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Harry Yoo raised concerns about the correctness of using this_cpu_add_8() and this_cpu_try_cmpxchg_8() in the patch, specifically on arm64 architecture, and questioned the assumption that __foo() is always called with IRQs disabled.

reviews.author: Qi Zheng
reviews.summary: Qi Zheng raised a concern about the patch [PATCH 1/4] memcg: use mod_node_page_state to update stats, specifically pointing out that spin_lock_irq() doesn't disable IRQ on PREEMPT_RT and may lead to bugs in -stable kernels.

reviews.author: Roman Gushchin
reviews.summary: Roman Gushchin reviewed the patch series and approved all patches with Acked-by tags, but also suggested that a benchmark focused on memcg stats is needed to measure performance improvements and regressions.

reviews.author: Dev Jain
reviews.summary: Dev Jain raised concerns about a regression in the micromm/munmap benchmark on arm64 due to the patch's changes, specifically the unconditional overhead of doing this_cpu_try_cmpxchg() in certain code paths.
